text: Best python style for complex one-liners
I recently wrote a rather ugly looking one-liner, and was wondering if it is better python style to break it up into multiple lines, or leave it as a commented one-liner.
I looked in PEP 8, but it did not mention anything about this
This is the code I wrote:

code:
def getlink(url):
    return(urllib.urlopen(url).readlines()[425].split('"')[7])
    # Fetch the page at "url", read the 426th line, split it along
    # quotes, and return the 8th quote delimited section

text: But would something like this be better style?

code:
def getlink(url):
    url_file = urllib.urlopen(url)
    url_data = url_file.readlines()
    line = url_data[425]
    line = line.split('"')
    return line[7]
